intro: Pleroma hispidum, commonly known as the rough pleroma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the common name "rough pleroma." It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flower colors.
